overview: I have a mix of science, educational outreach, and business startup experiences. Professionally trained as a neuroscientist, I conducted human brain imaging research at Vanderbilt before starting my PhD in Cognitive Neuroscience. In 2008, I founded the Nashville Learning Group, a tutoring company which connected graduate students to Nashville families. Wanting to provide the same high-end services for underprivileged families, I created a non-profit called The LYATH Foundation in 2009. Since leaving my PhD in Neuroscience, I founded Schrader Labs, LLC as an entrepreneurial think-tank for innovative networking solutions. Our first project is Pearescope, a mobile social networking service which introduces you to nearby mutual LinkedIN and Facebook friends.
